plugins.name: DS Housekeeper
plugins.description:
Tidy up your design files with ease!


If you've ever dealt with massive design files, or worked with multiple libraries, you've probably encountered these issues during maintenance:

  1. I have a style, but I don't know which layers are using it or whether it's totally unused?
  2. I want to swap some layers to a new style, but it's taking forever cos those layers are scattered all over my file!
  3. I want to delete some specific layers or instances, but it's an absolute chore for the same reason above!


Here's how DS Housekeeper can help you:

  1. Get a view of every layer/instance used by a given style, including a page-by-page breakdown and option to view all layer/instances in each page
  2. Swap layers of a given style to another style, or delete them all, in a click of a button!



How to Use?


  1. after the plugin has loaded all your styles and components, click Scan to find all layers/instances used by it
  2. if a style has layers, click on down arrow to view details sorted by each page
  3. right-click on each page entry to either view, swap or delete those layers



Update:


Hi everyone, this plugin is getting a major update!

I‚Äôve renamed it to Design System (DS) Housekeeper to better reflect its purpose and features.

Apart from overhauling the UI, I‚Äôve also added some new features:

- *Able to delete layers/instances and styles

- *Able to swap layers/instances to other relevant styles eg. swap text layers from one text style to other text styles

- *Able to search for remote styles

- Able to refresh UI when editing user file outside of the plugin

- Able to search for styles using search bar (helpful when you have hundreds of styles)



Bug Report/Feedback


If you encounter any bugs, send me the details at zackhongux@gmail.com.

To make it easier for me to pinpoint the issue, you can include screenshots or recordings of the problem, or even share the link to your Figma file (if you‚Äôre comfortable with that).


If you have any suggestions about my plugin, feel free to leave a comment below! I might consider implementing it if a suggestion is really popular, and if I have the technical know-how to do it.



Future plans:


I hope to make use of Figma‚Äôs REST api to retrieve various info like remote styles and thumbnails quickly.

I'm also planning to implement a selection mode where you can view a breakdown of styles used and edit those layers/instances whenever you make a selection in your design file.
plugins.tagline: Tidy up your design files with ease!

plugins.name: FigNative Beta
plugins.description:
FigNative (Beta)

Introducing FigNative, a powerful and intuitive Figma plugin that allows you to generate React Native code directly from your Figma designs. FigNative is currently in beta and free to use, making it an excellent opportunity for developers and designers to streamline their workflow and save time when building React Native applications.


Key Features:

Generate React Native code: Convert Figma elements, including frames, rectangles, groups, and text layers, into React Native components with a single click.


Auto Layout support: FigNative supports Figma's Auto Layout, translating it into flexbox styles for responsive and adaptive designs in React Native.


Generate buttons: To generate a button, create a Figma element (e.g., frame, rectangle, or group) and name it with the prefix #btn#. The plugin will then generate a TouchableOpacity component with the onPress event. If there is a text layer inside the element, the text will be used as the button label.

Example: #btn#


Generate text input fields: To generate a text input field, create a text layer and name it with the prefix #input#. The plugin will generate a TextInput component in the React Native code. The text inside the layer will be used as the placeholder text for the input field.

Example: #input#


Generate password input fields: To create a password input field, name a text layer with the prefix #input-password#. The plugin will generate a TextInput component with the secureTextEntry property set to true.

Example: #input-password#


Review and optimize output: Review the generated code and make any necessary adjustments before integrating it into your React Native project.


Beta version: FigNative is currently in beta, which means you can access and use it for free! We're continuously working on improving the plugin and would love to hear your feedback.

Get started with FigNative today and enhance your Figma-to-React Native workflow. We're excited to see what you create! Don't forget to share your feedback and suggestions to help us make FigNative even better. Happy designing and coding!


FigNative Roadmap: Upcoming Features and Improvements

  1. Nested Components Support: Enhance the plugin to support Figma components and instances, preserving the component structure in the generated React Native code.
  2. Responsive Layouts: Add support for generating responsive designs that automatically adapt to different device sizes and screen orientations.
  3. Export Images and Assets: Automatically export images and other assets used in the Figma design, and generate the appropriate code to include them in the React Native project.
  4. Custom Component Mapping: Allow users to map Figma elements to their own custom React Native components, providing better integration with existing design systems and component libraries.
  5. Variant Support: Implement support for Figma variants, making it easier to generate code for different component states or themes.
  6. Optimized Code Output: Improve the generated code to follow best practices and performance optimizations, making it production-ready out of the box.
  7. Style Export: Export styles (e.g., typography, colors, and spacing) as reusable constants or theme configurations for the React Native project.
  8. Animation Support: Detect and convert Figma animations and transitions to their equivalent React Native Animated or Lottie animations.
  9. Integration with Popular React Native Libraries: Automatically generate code that integrates with popular React Native libraries like React Navigation, Redux, or MobX.
  10. Plugin Configuration: Allow users to configure various aspects of the code generation, such as indentation, quotes, and file formats.
  11. Batch Export: Enable users to select multiple Figma layers at once and generate code for all of them simultaneously, speeding up the development process.
  12. Platform-Specific Code: Generate platform-specific code (iOS and Android) based on the Figma design when needed.
  13. Figma Design Tokens Support: Automatically extract and utilize design tokens from Figma, making it easier to maintain a consistent design system.
  14. Improved Error Handling and Feedback: Provide better feedback and error handling when encountering unsupported elements or issues during code generation.
  15. Code Preview: Add a live preview of the generated React Native components directly within the Figma interface, helping users to visualize the final output.

accepted.name: Onome Ben
accepted.description: Enthusiastic and passionate Figma plugin developer, dedicated to creating innovative solutions that enhance design-to-code workflows and elevate user experience

plugins.tagline: Powerful and intuitive Figma plugin that allows you to generate React Native code .

plugins.name: Color Contrast: Creating a Sense of Depth and Dimension of colors.
plugins.description: Color contrast is the difference in lightness and darkness between two colors. It is measured by the contrast ratio, which is the ratio of the lightness of the foreground color to the lightness of the background color. A higher contrast ratio means that the two colors are more different from each other, and therefore easier to see.

It is measured by the contrast ratio, which is the ratio of the lightness of the foreground color to the lightness of the background color. A higher contrast ratio means that the two colors are more different from each other, and therefore easier to see.
93728.tagline: Creating a Sense of Depth and Dimension of colors.

plugins.name: Color Time
plugins.description:
Adjust H,S, and L color values across selected elements with different colors.


Here are some things you could do:

  • Select elements with all different colors and set the Saturation value to 50
  • Increment the Hue on selected elements (with different colors) by 10
  • Set the Lightness value on selected elements to 42


Note: This is a WIP plugin and only works for elements with fills (like text and shapes). Groups, gradients and other selections won't work.

plugins.name: Themeizer
plugins.description:
Themeizer is an ecosystem for adding theme support to your designs and code. Use this plugin to change themes in your designs and publish them to the cloud.

To change theme in Figma

Preparation

  1. Create folders with colors for all your themes, where folder name is the name of theme

Usage

  1. Select an element
  2. Choose another theme

Example

  • Create color folders with valid themes. For example
light/primary: #1A237E
light/body: #212121
light/antibody: #FAFAFA
dark/primary: #C5CAE9
dark/body: #FAFAFA
dark/antibody: #212121
  • Create a simple frame with light (or dark) colors;
  • Go to the themes tab, select the frame you created, select another theme in the plugin ("themes" tab -> click on needed theme -> click the "select" button).


To change colors in your project

Advanced for developers

Preparation

  1. Set up themes as described above
  2. Specify in the settings the address to the API and the necessary headers. Save the settings.
  3. Add and configure needed packages to your project [read more]

Usage

  1. Go to the publish tab and publish ypur changes.
  2. Be happy, new colors in your site.

Example

  • Registry in jsonbin.io
  • Create a new bin with mock json ({"data": {}})
  • Open plugin settings tab
  • Add your bin url to the "Save at" option (https://api.jsonbin.io/v3/b/6g4gjd56u, where 6g4gjd56u is your bin id)
  • Add the url of the latest version of your bin as "Read from" option (https://api.jsonbin.io/v3/b/6g4gjd56u/latest)
  • Add the required headers ({"X-Master-Key": "some-private-key", "Content-Type": "application/json", "X-Bin-Meta": "false"}, where X-Master-Key is your private key [https://jsonbin.io/api-keys])
  • Install themeizer
  • Configure the environment as written in the package description. The url would be equal to the "Save at" option, the headers would be equal.

plugins.name: bobbie
plugins.description:
Bobbie is your best work companion! Yes, Bobbies is a good cat! In reality, he really wants to purr on your lap, but since he's in the matrix, he can only send you all his love and writing assistance via AI and the internet! Nevertheless, he left us a little note:


"I'm not your average kitten. Adopted by an artificial intelligence researcher, I grew up surrounded by computers and cables. Fascinated by technology, I became a feline expert in programming and coding, and today I share my knowledge with humans. #GeekCat Meow! üêæ"


So, Bob or "Bies" (for those in the know), is your everyday little buddy (and we all know that animals are our most loyal companions!):


  • By making you laugh,
  • By stroking your ego,
  • Or by sending you "good vibes" purrs
  • A kitten directly connected to Chat GPT to assist you in writing punchlines and answering almost all your questions (he has some limitations but you already know them ;))
  • And then (because you really need to work too) he gives you some little Figma tips ;)


In short, Bobbies: it's cute, it's almost super useful, it's purring all the way, it's self-love, so install Bobbies to work in purring mode! (And it seems that cats even lower stress!) It's good, it's great, it's Bobbie!"


Incoming Feature :

  • internationalisation
  • design

plugins.name: Tree Navigator ‚Äì¬†Select similar layers
plugins.description:
With Tree Navigator, navigating patterns with repeated elements like lists, tables or other complex designs becomes much easier.


How it Works


Watch demo videos here: www.kaimagnus.de/articles/using-the-tree-navigator-plugin


When working with tables for example, selecting all cells in the whole table or a column is a common task. To do this in Tree Navigator, simply select one cell and the plugin will show a list of all its ancestor layers (e. g. Column, Table, Frame 2254, Page 1). Choose the "Table" frame and Tree Navigator will select all cells in that table. Choose the "Column" frame and it will select all cells in just that column.


The magic happens if you select a cell in column A and another in column B. Tree Navigator will additionally display an option to get a selection of all cells in just those two columns, ignoring cells in other columns.


This way, you can select similar elements in various scopes very easily and something that normally takes careful box dragging becomes much less cumbersome.



Layer Search


Tree Navigator also includes a layer search. Like the native Figma search, it is possible to enter a search term and to filter the results by layer type. Additionally, a search can also be scoped to the current selection or the current top level frame. The available filters are:


  • Layer type
  • Search scope (whole page, current selection, top level frame)
  • Case sensitivity
  • Fuzzy and exact search


Recent Searches


Performing a search will save the selected filter settings to make it easy to rerun common searches in the future. Recent searches are shared in a file, so you and your colleagues can access and rerun the same common searches.


Contribution and Feature Requests


View the source code on GitHub: https://github.com/KaiMagnusMueller/Find-Nodes. To submit bug reports and feature requests, feel free to use the issue templates to share your ideas.
plugins.tagline: Speed up your work with tables, quickly select similar layers in parent and sibling frames.

plugins.name: POEditor
plugins.description:
What is POEditor?


POEditor is a highly scalable online translation platform and localization management system, designed to bring together developers, product managers, translators, designers and copywriters in their effort of making multilingual software, and to automate the localization workflow.


Trusted by companies like Bosch, Adidas and Ubisoft, POEditor brings transparency to the localization process, boosting productivity and collaboration between product, design and localization teams and helping avoid possible localization bugs.


For more information on the POEditor platform, please visit: https://poeditor.com/


How Figma and POEditor work together


To connect Figma to a POEditor account, enter the API key of that POEditor account in the Figma plugin.


You‚Äôll be able to create new projects on that account using the plugin, or work with projects which already exist in POEditor.


The POEditor plugin for Figma works both ways, so you can send texts from Figma files to POEditor translation projects and fetch translations from POEditor to Figma.


In POEditor, multiple translation options are available: 

  • assigning your own translators to specific languages, by adding them as contributors
  • crowdsourcing translations from your community, using public projects
  • ordering human translation services from integrated language service providers
  • using machine translation APIs from DeepL, Google or Microsoft


More information on how the POEditor Figma plugin works here.
plugins.tagline: The localization management platform that's easy to use!

plugins.name: Run GitHub Actions workflows
plugins.description:
Run GitHub Actions workflows directly within Figma, using the selected page and nodes as inputs.



Setup for GitHub


Begin by creating a GitHub Actions workflow.


Configure your workflow to run on workflow_dispatch event:

on:
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      fileKey:
        description: Figma file key
        type: string
        required: true
      page:
        description: Stringified selected page (id, name)
        type: string
        default: '{}'
        required: true
      selection:
        description: Stringified array of the selected nodes (id, name)
        type: string
        default: '[]'
        required: true

As previously mentioned, the plugin triggers the workflow sending the fileKey, the selected page, and the list of selected nodes as selection.


You can then configure the workflow according to your needs. To get started, you can use this example from-figma.yaml.


You can also manipulate the received inputs as needed. Refer to this working example.



Setup for Figma


Setting up in Figma is simple:

  1. Run this plugin.
  2. Enter the fileKey.
  3. Setup a new workflow by clicking the + button (you'll also need a GitHub access token).


Finally, select a page and one or more nodes, and then click ‚ñ∂. This will run the selected workflow, passing your selection as workflow inputs.



Figma Export PDFs


What do you think about exporting Figma content as PDF document to an FTP Server, just by clicking a button within Figma? Would it be cool, isn't it?


Check out this workflow and discover how it's entirely feasible. Simply clone the workflow and setup this Figma plugin üòâ.

accepted.description: üë®üèª‚Äçüíª ¬†Enthusiastic Web Developer

plugins.name: Ad Lib
plugins.description:
Find instances of your library components and styles, in any design file. Manage your design system more easily.


1. How does it work? 


  1. First, go to your Figma settings and get a personal access token (aka a key which enables you, and only you, to communicate with your files),
  2. Then, copy / paste the links of both the library and the design file you want to inspect (those are the same links you use when your share a file, using the "Share" button)
  3. After a while, you should then see a list of all instances & styles found in your design file. Click on one, so you can browse and find more precisely where they are located in your file.


2. Notes 


  • Please note that your personal token won't be shared or used in any way.
  • This plugin doesn't modify anything in your design (it only inspects, nothing more)
  • You need to be a least a member of a Team, otherwise you can't really use librairies, and this plugin won't be useful
  • All the files you can inspect must be created by you, or come from a Team you're a member of
  • You need to launch the plugin in the design file you wish to inspect, in order to be able to find all the instances
  • The bigger the files, the longer you'll have to wait ! So, please be patient sometimes :)
  • tip : you can paste the same library link in both input fields, so you can find instances of your library components inside your own library


If you find bugs, possible improvements, please feel free to contact me.

plugins.name: Dot Matrix
plugins.description:
Dot Matrix is a Figma plugin that creates customisable 11x11 dot matrix icons. You can design icon by toggling dots on a grid, and the plugin generates two 24x24 pixel frames: one with white background and black dots, and another with black background and white dots. This tool is ideal for creating simple, pixel-based icons or patterns directly within Figma.


Key features:


Add design reference of your choice

Interactive 11x11 grid for icon design

Generates two colour variants automatically

Creates vector-based, scalable outputs

Works offline with no external network access


To use:


  1. Open the plugin in Figma
  2. Toggle dots on the 11x11grid to create your design
  3. Click "Apply" to generate the icons


Limitation: The plugin is limited to 11x11 grid designs and fixed colour schemes (black and white) at this moment

plugins.name: gluestack
plugins.description:
gluestack is a powerful Figma Plugin designed to streamline and enhance your design workflow. This versatile plugin empowers designers by simplifying two essential aspects of design consistency ‚Äì color palettes and typography.


With the gluestack you can effortlessly manage and update your color palette tokens. Say goodbye to the time-consuming task of manually adjusting alpha values and hexadecimal color codes one by one. This plugin allows you to update all your alpha tokens at once, ensuring that your color palette remains consistent and on-brand with just a few clicks.


But that's not all, gluestack takes design efficiency to the next level by providing a seamless solution for typography consistency. With this plugin, you can easily update font families across all your text style tokens. Whether you're fine-tuning font choices for headings or refining typography for body text, "GlueStack Token Editor" makes it a breeze to maintain a cohesive and polished look throughout your design projects.


Key Features:


  • Batch update alpha tokens for a consistent color palette.
  • Effortlessly modify font families across various text style tokens.
  • Enhance design consistency and save valuable time in the process.
  • Streamline your design workflow for more productive and cohesive projects.


gluestack is your go-to tool for maintaining design consistency, enhancing productivity, and ensuring that your Figma designs are always on point. Try it out and experience a new level of design efficiency today!

accepted.name: gluestack
accepted.description: Design kit that emulates all of the utility props from gluestack-ui. Seamlessly integrate style guides, UI components, and pages into your web and mobile apps.

plugins.tagline: Streamline Colors and Typography in Figma with Ease

plugins.name: Simple 3D Viewer
plugins.description:
This open-source Figma plugin allows you to view and interact with 3D designs directly within Figma and export them.


Usage:

  1. Open Figma and go to the Plugins section.
  2. Search for "Simple 3D Viewer" and install the plugin.
  3. Open the plugin and load your 3D model to start viewing and interacting with it. (Currently, only .fbx and .obj files are supported. Other formats will be supported in the future.)
  4. Export the scene into your Figma design.


Credits:

3D designs used in UI are created by Nashekrashe Studio.


Check the GitHub repository for contributions and details.

Check out my personal website to learn more about me or get in touch (I'd be happy to see you there).
plugins.tagline: A free Figma plugin that allows you to view 3D designs directly within Figma and export them.

plugins.name: Alpha Remover
plugins.description:
Alpha Remover is a simple yet powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline your workflow when exporting PNG images without alpha channels. With just a single click, you can export your selected object as a PNG file, automatically removing any transparency.


Key features:


  1. One-click export: Select an object and export it instantly
  2. Automatic alpha channel removal: All exported PNGs will have full opacity
  3. User-friendly interface: Clear instructions and intuitive design
  4. Efficient workflow: Save time on manual post-processing of exported images


This plugin is particularly useful for app developers and designers who need to submit icons to the App Store. Apple requires that app icons do not contain an alpha channel, and Alpha Remover makes it easy to prepare your icons for submission, ensuring they meet this specific requirement.


Whether you're preparing assets for web use, creating icons for app stores, or need fully opaque images for print, Alpha Remover simplifies the process and ensures consistent results every time. It helps you avoid common pitfalls in asset preparation, such as rejected app submissions due to incorrect icon formats.
plugins.tagline: Export PNG images without alpha channels effortlessly

plugins.name: Figma to Justinmind
plugins.description:
Export your designs to Justinmind and turn them into hi-fi prototypes and simulations


Justinmind is an advanced prototyping tool with powerful interaction design capabilities that allows you to create and simulate realistic web and mobile apps that mirror the final product to validate and get feedback.


Exporting frames from Figma to Justinmind allows you to quickly and efficiently turn them into wireframes or high fidelity prototypes. This free plugin gives you great control to export Figma projects to Justinmind. So whether you want to export your entire project or just selected design frames, the plugin will allow you to easily export your assets and frames.


Get help


Discover how to use it here: exporting from Figma to Justinmind.


If you have any questions, bug reports or feature requests, feel free to contact us at the Justinmind community support.

plugins.name: CSS variables import/export
plugins.description:
Copy, export, or import your local Figma variables into CSS variables format.


Each collection is split up into modes and these are printed as "root:" groups in the CSS output.


This allows you to restructure the output into your preferred code format.


There are 3 tabs in the Export tab:

  1. All variables ‚Äì Print all of your local variables in CSS variables format
  2. Cherry pick ‚Äì Pick two collections to print. For example, a primitive and semantic collection
  3. All local variables ‚Äì Each collection is shown as a scrollable table


And 2 tabs in the Import tab:

  1. Paste CSS ‚Äì copy from your file and paste CSS variables, then import them as Figma variables
  2. Upload File ‚Äì Drag and drop a CSS file into the plugin to generate your variables, including aliases

plugins.name: Vizard -> Design handoff for marketers
plugins.description:
Join the top brands and agencies using Vizard to scale their creatives.


‚úÖ Handoff ‚úÖ Personalization at scale ‚úÖ Creative Automation


Designers

Look, we know your time is precious!

You don't enjoy talking to the marketing fellas, do you? They want you to center-align a triangle in a circle; they don't really know what a visual center is!


Vizard lets you keep control of design guidelines while saving you all the time of going back & forth with marketers.


You already handled the developers with Figma/Zeplin, good job! üëè Marketers are your mile. This is your true fire & forget!


Features

  • Handoff designs to other stakeholders while keeping your Figma designs intact
  • Seamlessly collaborate with marketers
  • Save your precious time by doing things ONCE!


Now, please skip the next section. Promise?


Marketers

Here is our little secret - We really made Vizard for you! Sssshhh..! We are giving you control to own your assets & the freedom to make unlimited versions of them without bothering the designers. No need to learn a design software & yet be able to generate thousands of variations on-brand!


Features

  • Scale your design workflow
  • Generate unlimited variations without involving designers
  • No need for design knowledge or extra training


How to use

  1. Sign-up on https://studio.vizardapps.com
  2. Install Vizard Figma Plugin
  3. Select one or more Frames that you would like to share with the marketing team, run the plugin
  4. (First time only) Click on 'Connect Vizard'. It will open authorization page in browser. Click on 'Authorize Figma'
  5. If the preview looks good, click 'Send to Vizard'. That's it!
  6. The design will be available to you & your marketing team under Your Templates on https://studio.vizardapps.com


Known issues

  • Mixed styling in text is currently not supported
  • Currently, only Google fonts are supported. All non-google fonts are converted to Fira Sans font
  • Figma Arrow elements get imported as straight lines
  • Only outside stroke is supported. Inside & center strokes get converted to outside strokes


For questions & suggestions, please reach out to us at hello@vizardapps.com


Learn more about Vizard at www.vizardapps.com

accepted.name: Amardeep Singh
accepted.description: Building Vizard -> Design handoff for marketers

plugins.name: UX writing status
plugins.description:
Keep track of your UX writing copy for each text layer inside a frame.


Allow your team to follow the status of any copy while staying full in context, without leaving Figma.


As a UX writer or product designer, you will be able to identify the progress of the work that is being done for a copy inside a frame, you can set the following status for your text:

To do

In progress

To review

Done


The Plugin will add the status in the name of the layer.


Github

24641.description:
Keep track of your UX writing copy for each text layer inside a frame.


Allow your team to follow the status of any copy while staying full in context, without leaving Figma.


As a UX writer or product designer, you will be able to identify the progress of the work that is being done for a copy inside a frame, you can set the following status for your text:

To do

In progress

To review

Done


The Plugin will add the status in the name of the layer.


Github

plugins.name: Sessions
plugins.description:
Showcase your artwork live in meetings with Sessions



Meeting collaboration tool meets vector graphics editor

Figma users worldwide are now able to showcase their designs during a virtual meeting powered by Sessions. Sessions is not just another video conferencing app. It is the platform that makes meetings better by bringing all your collaboration tools into one single space.


When it is time to present or ask a colleague for an opinion on your Figma project, it is dead easy to share it with them. When organizing a meeting in Sessions, in the agenda of the meeting where you design the time slots, it is now possible to dedicate time to display a Figma project in the meeting without having to share your screen. The best part of Sessions is that you can access all the other functionalities (taking notes, uploading resources) as well, in order to have a complete, engaging and productive meeting.


The wireframes are available in Sessions as static pictures displayed one after the other in the order added when exporting. All the participants present in the meeting are able to view the wireframes. 


With Sessions, there is no time like the present to share your prototype:

To be able to enjoy this capability, register an account with Sessions as well. Open an account free of charge with Sessions by accessing https://sessions.us.


Getting started:

  1. On your Figma design, add the Sessions plug-in. Click on Sync with Sessions. See details, here (https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/360040450413-Find-and-install-plugins ).
  2. The Sessions log-in page is displayed. If you are already logged in, you are asked for permissions.
  3. Export the wireframes you wish to present in the meeting. They are imported as resources in Sessions.
  4. Access Sessions with your newly created account. Create a From Scratch meeting and add the agenda block.
  5. Select for the agenda block the artifact Figma. Choose the wireframes recently exported. 
  6. Publish the session. That‚Äôs it!


This is what a sessions looks like: https://youtu.be/VNVg_aD1NPc


Join Sessions‚Äô Slack community at https://join.slack.com/t/sessionscommunity/shared_invite/zt-rsbysxs3-00rRoSXKiAz6bLU6QLy8NQ


Subscribe to our YouTube channel https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCmkBi4amiGhE68Q8RZVoAPw

plugins.name: Variables to Palettes
plugins.description:
Instantly create stunning color palettes with your variables.

Palettes Variables - your go-to tool for vibrant designs.


Here's what you can do with this plugin:

  1. Instant Palette Generation: Create beautiful color schemes with a single click.
  2. Advanced Color Spaces: Utilize HCL and OKLab under the hood for visually appealing and accessible designs.
  3. Sync themes easily: Apply and sync color themes across multiple files to keep your projects consistent.
  4. Transfer variables smoothly: Import and export your variable collections without any hassle, making collaboration a breeze.


üëÄ Want to see it in action? Watch our tutorial video above and see how it can improve your design process.

External site settings are configured in plugin settings.
